stories.text:
I'm very good at CSS but I despise writing 1000s lines of code, one page can easily get 500 lines+. I really wish there were programs that could output good UI code, ie. Adobe XD to proper Html/CSS

but I've not found any.

So I tried using just UI frameworks like Bootstrap, however, but learning curve was bigger and every page looked the same. (And don't suggest tailwind)

Maybe there is outsourced service to whom I can give designs and get html/css back for very low cost like $10-20 per page. I tried one at fiver and it was far from pixel perfect and wasn't mobile responsive.
stories.title: Ask HN: What the fastest way to get UI built?
YouTube pulls Jan. 6 committee post, citing election disinformation

stories.text:
Every user has an RSS feed and a page for a personal feed. Front page of site is a list ranked by most followed feeds, time, etc.

Each RSS item has comments, with no karma system to discourage echo chambers. Flag system with light guidelines to avoid 4chan effect, but loose enough to let users post anything racist, homophobic etc. Every user can see each other’s feed list and obviously add to their own.

I’m wondering if people would find this interesting and useful.
stories.title: Ask HN: How about a Reddit style RSS reader?
